note: Joey: (lying on a beach towel, recapping what happened in the last episode) Okay, so we went to the beach, because Phoebe found out about this lady who knew her mom and dad, and I don’t really know what happened with that.

content.text: [cut to Phoebe Sr.’s house, from the last episode]

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: I’m your mother.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ehh?
[cut to Monica opening the door of the beach house, with Chandler trying to pick her up for a date.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, and then Monica joked that she wouldn’t go out with a guy like Chandler…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: (in a funny voice) Hi there. (Monica turns her head away in disgust)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …and he couldn’t let it go, and… I don’t really know what happened with that either.
[cut to a montage of scenes involving Bonnie, Ross, and Rachel from the last episode.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh! And then Ross’s new girlfriend, Bonnie, shows up and Rachel convinced her to save her head. And then Ross and Rachel kiss, and now Ross has to choose between Rachel and the bald girl and I don’t know what happened there either…
[cut back to Joey on the beach towel]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what, hold on, let me go get Chandler. (gets up and leaves.)

content.description: The beach house, it’s the same scene from the end of last year, with Ross in front of the two doors of Rachel’s and Bonnie’s rooms, trying to decide which door to choose. He finally chooses the one his right and goes in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel and Bonnie
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Rachel was just helping me out. My head got all sunburned.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Awww.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Thanks a million.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you’re welcome a million.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: (to Ross) Okay, I’ll see you in our room.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. (closes the door, and goes over and kisses Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.
(They both kiss again and fall onto the bed.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I gotta go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa! What?! Why?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I-I gotta go break up with Bonnie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here?! Now?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, yeah. I can’t-I can’t stay here all night, and if I go in there she’s-she’s gonna wanna… do stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, can’t you tell her that you are not in the mood?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, she likes that. Yeah. Faking sleep doesn’t work either, I can’t tell you how many mornings I woke up with her…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa-ho.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa-oh, okay! Yeah, why am I telling you that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know.
(they kiss again)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah. (opens the door) It wasn’t every morning.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, making it worse!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.description: Phoebe Sr.’s house, it’s right after she told Phoebe that she’s her birth mother.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: So I guess you’d like to know how it all happened.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I mean I, well I think I can figure it out. I guess y’know I was born, and everyone started lying their asses off!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Noo! No! It wasn’t like that I… Remember how I told you how Lily, Frank, and I we were, we were close. Well, we were, we were very close.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How close?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Well, the-the three of us we were, kind of umm, a couple.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t even know how that would work!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Well, we were…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m not asking!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Well, any how, some how I got pregnant, and, and I was scared. I was stupid and sellfish, and I was 18 years old. I mean, you remember what it’s like to be eighteen years old?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Let’s see, my had Mom killed herself, and my Dad had run off, and I was living in a Gremlin with a guy named Cindy who talked to his hand.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Well, I’m so sorry. I thought I was leaving you with the best parents in the world, I didn’t even hear about your Mom and Dad til a couple of years ago, and by then you were already grown up. I don’t know, you’re here, and I would, I would really, I would like to get to know you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, well, everybody does! I’m a really cool person. And y’know you had 29 years to find that out, but you didn’t even try! Y’know what, you walked out on me, and I’m just, I’m gonna do the same thing to you.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Wait!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t ever want to see you again!
(She walks out and slams the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, where’s my purse?
content.parenthetical: walking back in with her hand over her eyes.

content.description: The beach house, Joey and Chandler are sitting at the dinner table, Monica is looking in the fridge.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shoot! We’re out of soda.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’ll go out and get you some.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nope! Because I’m not your boyfriend. (to Phoebe, who’s entering) Hey Pheebs, how did it go?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, umm, my Mom’s friend, Phoebe, is actually my birth Mom.
(The gang is shocked.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I found a dried up seashores.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sweety, what are you talking about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, my new Mom, who-who’s a big, fat abandoner! (starts to go upstairs)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, wait, Pheebs, wait a second! Don’t you wanna stay here and talk about it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. I’m just, I wanna, I need to be alone.
(She starts to go upstairs.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.description: The beach house, Rachel’s bedroom. She is finishing up writing something as Ross walks through the door.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s over.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, was it awful?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, it was loong. I didn’t even realise how late it was, until I noticed the 5 o’clock shadow on her head. (They both start to laugh, then stop themselves quickly.) Anyway, she didn’t want to stay. I called a cab; she just left.
(They kiss.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I wrote you a letter.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh! Thank you! I like mail. (He goes to kiss her again, but she turns away.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s just some things I’ve been thinking about. Some things about us, and before we can even think about the two of us getting back together, I just need to know how you feel about this stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (He leans in to kiss her again, but she leans back preventing him from making contact.) Wow, it’s-it’s 5:30 in the morning. (Rachel laughs) So, I’d better get cracking on this baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’ll be waiting for you, just come up when you’re done.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’ll be up in, (looks at the letter) 18 pages. Front and back. Very exciting.

content.description: The beach house, the next morning. Ross is passed out on the kitchen counter. He wakes up with a start and has one of the pages of the letter stuck to his face.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. (looks at his watch) Oh-oh. (takes a drink of coffee and resumes reading the letter)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! (Ross jumps up, and quickly puts the letter back together, pretending like he has just finished it.) What happened to you? Why didn’t you come up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Done!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You just finished?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, very important to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So umm, does it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Does it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole ‘Does it?’ part just another glance.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you talking about, Ross, you just said that you read it twice! Look, y’know what, either it does or it doesn’t, and if you have to even think about it…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, Rach, no. I don’t, I don’t, I don’t have to think about it, in fact, I’ve decided, I’ve decided that, that it……does.
(Rachel stands there for a moment, starting to cry. Then gasps and runs over and hugs him. While hugging her, Ross tries to find the ‘Does it?’ part in the letter.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, sure! I’m sure.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. (Hugs him more violently this time and pushes him back away from the letter.)

content.description: The beach. Chandler and Monica are out getting some sun.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, there’s a nuclear holocaust, I’m the last man on Earth. Would you go out with me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ennnh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ve got canned goods.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you guys! Take a look at this! (Chandler and Monica jump up and go over to the hole.) Check this baby out, dug me a hole!
content.parenthetical: jumping up in a hole that he is digging, he is shoulder deep

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excellent hole, Joe.
(A wave crashes on the beach and partially fills up his hole.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no! No!! My hole!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ow!! Ow!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! What?!! What is it?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Jellyfish sting! Oh, it hurts! It hurts!! It hurts!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, can we help?! You want us to take you back to the house?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s like two miles!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, and I’m a little tired from digging the hole.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh damn the jellyfish. Damn all the jellyfish!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’ve got to do something!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, there’s really only one thing you can do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! What is it?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re gonna have to pee on it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!! Gross!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t blame me, I saw it on The Discovery Channel .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, he’s right. There’s something like uh, ammonia in that, that like kills the pain.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well forget it! It doesn’t hurt that (tries to take a step) baaad !!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you want some privacy you can use my hole.

content.description: The beach house, Phoebe is coming down the stairs all packed and ready to go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’m ready to get the hell out of here! (Sees Ross and Rachel cuddling on the couch.) Oh. Are you? Are you?!! (they nod ‘Yes.’) Ohh! That’s so great!! Ooh, not for Bonnie. (they nod ‘No.’) But for you, yay! Ohh.
(The rest of the gang arrives with their heads down in shame.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How was the beach?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing. I’m gonna take a shower.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Me too!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’m gonna put this (her suitcase) in the car.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I have to go pack. (Gets up to do so.) It really does?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It does. It really and truly does.
(Rachel kisses him, and goes upstairs. After she’s gone, Ross frantically tries to find and read the ‘Does it?’ part.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: (looks up in disgust) It so does not !!!

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is telling Joey and Chandler about the letter.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She wants me to take responsibility for everything that went wrong in our relationship. I mean she goes on for five pages about, about how I was unfaithful to her! (Both Joey and Chandler shrug their shoulders as to say ”Well…”) (yelling) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! If you say that one more time, I’m gonna break up with you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine! Fine! But this break-up was not all my fault, and she, she says here, (reading from the letter) “If you accept full responsibility…” (to Chandler and Joey) Full responsibility! “…I can begin to trust you again. Does that seem like something you can do. (yells at Joey) Does it?!!”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, Ross, you have what you want, you’re back with Rachel. If you bring this up now you’re gonna wreck the best thing that even happened to you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I know. I mean, no, you’re right. Yeah I guess I’ll let it go. But you-you understand how-how hard it is to forget about this.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure, it’s hard to forget! But that doesn’t mean you have to talk about it! A lot of things happened on that trip that we should never, (to Chandler) ever talk about.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What the hell happened on that beach?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s between us and the sea, Ross!
(Ross laughs and has a ‘Come on…’ look on his face as he looks and Chandler who nods his head in agreement with Joey. Ross is stunned.)

content.description: A hallway in an apartment building. Phoebe is knocks on a door and it opens.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, Ursula.
content.parenthetical: to the person that answered the door

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, well umm, I know that we haven’t talked in a long time, but umm okay, our Mom is not our birth Mom. This-this other lady is our birth Mom.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Right, okay, the one that lives in Montuak, umm-hmm.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know her?!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: No, I umm, I read about her in Mom’s suicide note.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There-there was a suicide note?! (Ursula nods ‘Yes.’) Well, do you still have it?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Hang on. (She goes into her apartment and slams the door in Phoebe’s face.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe you didn’t tell me there was a suicide note!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah. So how have you been doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I, umm, shut up!
(Ursula opens the door and hands her the note.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “Good-bye Phoebe and Ursula. I’ll miss you. P.S. Your Mom lives in Montauk.” You just wrote this!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Well, it’s pretty much the gist. Well, except for the poem. You read the poem, right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Noooo!!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: All right, hang on! (She takes the note, goes back into her apartment and slams the door shut.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are sitting at the table eating dinner and not talking. Ross and Rachel are outside cuddling on the balcony.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pass the cheese, please.
(Joey hands her the cheese without looking at her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My God, you can’t even look at me! Can you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope.
(Phoebe enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Phoebe! We can talk to Phoebe!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. I’m-I’m to depressed to talk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll give you a thousand dollars to talk to us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you guys! What do you, what do you think about making that beach trip an annual thing?

content.speaker: Chandler, Monica, and Joey
content.text: NO!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, that’s it, you guys! What happened out there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? We took a walk, nothing happened. I can back with nothing all over me.

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Come on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened? Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. (gets up)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Joey, we swore we’d never tell!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They’ll never understand!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, we have to say something! We have to get it out! It’s eating me alive!! Monica got stung by a jellyfish.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right!! All right. (walks slowly into the living room) I got stung. Stung bad. I couldn’t stand. I-I couldn’t walk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We were two miles from the house. Scared and alone. We didn’t think we could make it. (He goes to put his hands on Monica’s shoulders but for some reason can quite complete the action and pulls back.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was in too much pain.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And I was tired from digging the huge hole!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And then Joey remembered something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’d seen this thing on The Discovery Channel …

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute! I saw that! On The Discovery Channel , yeah! About jellyfish and how if you… (stops suddenly and turns to look at Monica) Ewwww!! You peed on yourself?!

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Ewwww!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can’t say that!! You-you don’t know!! I mean I thought I was gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn’t…bend that way. So… (looks at Joey.)

content.speaker: Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel
content.text: Ewwww!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right I stepped up! She’s my friend and she needed help! And if I had too, I’d pee on anyone of you! Only, uhh, I couldn’t. I got the stage fright. I wanted to help, but there was too much pressure. So-so I uh, I turned to Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey kept screaming at me, “Do it now! Do it!! Do it! Do it now!!” Sometimes late at night I can still here the screaming.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s ‘cause sometimes I just do it through my wall to freak you out.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is finishing up a song.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “…fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my bedroommmm.” (applause) Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the colours in your bedroom. (Sees that Phoebe Sr. has entered, and to her) Except for you. You go away.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: I’ll go in a second, I-I just wanted to tell you that there hasn’t been a day where I didn’t regret giving you up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: No, I’m not done. I-I-I just want you to know that I, the reason I didn’t look you up was, well I was afraid that you’d react, just well like, the way, the way you’re reacting right now, and can’t we just, y’know, start from here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Sorry. But just one last thing. Y’know you came looking for family. I’m family, I’m it. Now, now I’m done. (starts to leave)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But, it’s not like we’re losing anything. Y’know?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Yeah, I guess you’re right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not like we-we know each other or anything. Or that have anything in common.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Well, I don’t know. I mean it’s not like we don’t have anything in common. I mean I like uh, pizza.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I like pizza!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: You do?! Wait, I like umm, the Beetles.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, so do I!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: I knew it, wow!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait-wait-wait, wait! Puppies. Cute or ugly?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Ohh, so cute.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, well! But umm, still I’m-I’m mad at you.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: I know. I’m mad at me too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well umm, do you wanna get something to eat? I’m kinda hungry.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
content.text: Hey! Me too!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, stop it. Now you’re just doing it to freak me out.

content.description: Rachel’s bedroom. Ross and Rachel have just finished consummating the new relationship.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-hooo, I missed you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I missed you too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I was soo nervous about that letter. But the way you owned up to everything, it just showed me how much you’ve grown. Y’know?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I suppose.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You have! Ross, you should give yourself credit. I mean my Mom never thought this would work out. It was all, “Once a cheater, always a cheater.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm-hmm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I just wish we hadn’t lost those four months, but if time was what you needed just to gain a little perspective…
[cut to Monica cleaning the floor in the kitchen]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: (to Monica) Coffee house?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You bet.
[cut back to Rachel’s bedroom with both of them hurriedly getting dressed]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And for the record, it took two people to break up this relationship!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took full responsibility for!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I didn’t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I didn’t finish the whole letter!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I fell asleep!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You fell asleep?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and back!! (they go into the living room, trapping Monica, Chandler, and Joey in the kitchen) (to Rachel) Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means ‘you are,’ Y-O-U-R means ‘your!’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know I can’t believe I even thought about getting back together again! We are so over!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind it)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, oh, and hey-hey-hey, those little spelling tips will come in handy when you’re at home on Saturday nights playing Scrabble with Monica!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry!! (to Ross) I just feel bad about all that sleep you’re gonna miss wishing you were with me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no-no-no don’t you worry about me falling asleep. I still have your letter!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And hey! Just so you know, it’s not that common! It doesn’t happen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I KNEW IT!!!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler and Monica are playing cards at the dinner table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gin.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We were playing Gin? Y’know if we were a couple, we could play this game naked.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Will you stop!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. All right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, all right, I think you’re great, I think you’re sweet, and you’re smart, and I love you. But you will always be the guy who peed on me.
